description:
The erection of 14 houses  6 maisonettes and 19 flats
and associated parking and external works as shown on
drawing no(s) 92/125/1/5/; TP/01/A; 02/A; 03/A; 04 and
05 and letter dated 15.09.92
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The details of the elevations and facing materials to be
    used on the building shall not be otherwise than as shall
    have been submitted to and approved by the Council before
    any work on the site is commenced.

Condition : 2 - No development shall take place until full details of hard
    and soft landscaping and means of enclosure of all unbuilt,
    open areas have been submitted to and approved by the
    Council.

Condition : 3 - All hard and soft landscaping works shall be carried out to
    later than the end of the following planting season, with
    others of similar size and species, unless the Council
    gives written consent to any variation.
    a reasonable standard in accordance with the approved
    landscape details by not later than the end of the planting
    season following completion of the development or any phase
    of the development, whichever is the sooner. Any trees or
    areas of planting which, within a period of 5 years from
    the completion of the development, die, are removed, or
    become seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced as
    soon as is reasonably possible and, in any case, by not

Condition : 4 - Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and
    Country Planning General Development Order 1988 (as
    amended) or any Order revoking and re-enacting that Order,
    no development within Part 1 (Classes A to H) and Part 2
    (Classes A to C) of Schedule 2 of that Order shall be
    carried out without the grant of planning permission having
    first been obtained from the Council.

Condition : 5 - The whole of the car parking accommodation shown on the
    drawings shall be provided and retained permanently for the
    parking of vehicles of the occupiers and users of the
    remainder of the building.

Condition : 6 - Two parking spaces shall be designated for the sole use of
    disabled residents of the developement hereby permitted.

Condition : 7 - Details of proposals for the storage and disposal of refuse
    shall be submitted to and approved by the Council. These
    works shall be completed in accordance with the approved
    details before the first residential unit is occupied.

Condition : 8 - Details of acoustic double glazing and sound attenuation
    mechanical ventilation, which shall be provided where the
    noise level exceeds 65dB(A) expressed as 24 hr Leq when
    measured 1 metre outside the windows of any habitable room,
    shall be submitted for approval by the Council before
    development hereby permitted commences.

Condition : 9 - Details of sound insulation, which shall ensure that
    internal noise levels with windows closed shall not exceed
    35dB(A) expressed as a 24 hr Leq in living rooms and 30
    dB(A) as a 24 hr Leq in bedrooms shall be submitted to the
    Council for approval before the development hereby
    permitted commences.

Condition : 10 - Details of a scheme of works to isolate the foundations of
    the proposed buildings from vibration, such that the
    Vibration Dose Values shall not exceed 0.4ms-1.75 eVDV
    during the day (0700-2200) and 0.13ms -1.75 eVDV during the
    night (2200-0700) shall be submitted for approval by the
    Council before development hereby permitted commences.

Condition : 11 - Demolition of the existing buildings shall only take place
    between the hours of 08.00am and 6.00pm Monday to Friday
    and not at all at weekends or bank holidays.

Condition : 12 - All trees on the site, or parts of trees growing from
    adjoining sites, unless shown on the permitted drawings to
    be removed, shall be retained and protected from damage to
    the satisfaction of the Council for the period of at least
    twelve months following the completion of the development
    hereby approved.

Condition : 13 - During the construction work all trees shown on the
    permitted drawings to be retained shall be protected in
    accordance with BS5837 "Trees in relation to construction".

Condition : 14 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building.

Condition : 15 - In order that the Council may give consideration to the
    details of the proposed development.

Condition : 16 - To ensure that the landscaping is carried out within a
    reasonable period and to maintain a satisfactory standard
    of visual amenity in the scheme.

Condition : 17 - To safeguard the visual amenities of the area and to
    prevent over-development of the site by controlling
    proposed extensions and alterations.

Condition : 18 - To ensure the permanent retention of the accommodation for
    parking purposes and to ensure that the use of the building
    does not add to traffic congestion.

Condition : 19 - To comply with Council policy and in the interests of
    disabled residents of the development hereby permitted.

Condition : 20 - To ensure that the details of refuse arrangements are
    satisfactory.

Condition : 21 - to 11 To safeguard the amenity of the residents and
    occupiers of the development hereby permitted.
Condition : 22 - to 13 In the interests of local amenity.
